intro: Euphorbia huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén euphorbia, is a succulent plant native to the Andean region of South America. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and leaves, which are adapted to store water in arid environments. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with toxic sap. Euphorbia huillensis is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained soil.
